# Change Request: CR-2024-0342

## Change Summary
**Title:** Production Web Server OS Upgrade (Ubuntu 20.04 → 22.04)
**Type:** Standard Change
**Priority:** Medium
**Risk Level:** Medium

## Requester Information
- **Requested By:** DevOps Team
- **Business Owner:** Platform Engineering
- **Change Manager:** [Assigned]

## Change Details

### Description
Upgrade operating system on production web servers (web-prod-01 through web-prod-04) from Ubuntu 20.04 LTS to Ubuntu 22.04 LTS to maintain security compliance and access latest features.

### Justification
- Ubuntu 20.04 approaching end of standard support
- Security patches require newer OS version
- Performance improvements in 22.04 kernel
- Compliance requirement for supported OS

### Scope
- 4 production web servers
- Load balancer configuration updates
- SSL certificate redeployment
- Application stack verification

## Schedule
- **Planned Start:** Saturday, 02:00 UTC
- **Planned End:** Saturday, 06:00 UTC
- **Maintenance Window:** 4 hours
- **Expected Downtime:** Rolling (< 15 min per server)

## Implementation Plan
1. Take VM snapshot of web-prod-01
2. Remove web-prod-01 from load balancer
3. Perform in-place upgrade to 22.04
4. Verify services and run smoke tests
5. Return web-prod-01 to load balancer
6. Repeat for remaining servers
7. Full regression testing
8. Update documentation

## Rollback Plan
- **Trigger:** Failed health checks post-upgrade
- **Procedure:** Restore VM from pre-change snapshot
- **RTO:** 15 minutes per server
- **Decision Point:** 30 minutes post-upgrade per server

## Risk Assessment
| Risk | Probability | Impact | Mitigation |
|------|------------|--------|------------|
| Service incompatibility | Low | High | Pre-tested in staging |
| Extended downtime | Low | Medium | Rolling deployment |
| Configuration loss | Low | High | VM snapshots |

## Approvals Required
- [ ] Technical Lead
- [ ] Change Advisory Board
- [ ] Business Owner

# Change Request: CR-2024-0343

## Change Summary
**Title:** Customer Portal Dark Mode Feature Deployment
**Type:** Normal Change
**Priority:** Low
**Risk Level:** Low

## Requester Information
- **Requested By:** Product Team
- **Business Owner:** Customer Experience
- **Change Manager:** [Assigned]

## Change Details

### Description
Deploy dark mode theme option to the customer portal, allowing users to toggle between light and dark interface themes.

### Justification
- Top requested feature from customer feedback
- Accessibility improvement for light-sensitive users
- Modern UX expectation
- Competitive parity

### Scope
- Frontend CSS/JS bundle update
- User preference storage (localStorage + account sync)
- No backend changes required
- No database migrations

## Schedule
- **Planned Start:** Tuesday, 10:00 UTC
- **Planned End:** Tuesday, 10:30 UTC
- **Maintenance Window:** 30 minutes
- **Expected Downtime:** None (zero-downtime deployment)

## Implementation Plan
1. Enable feature flag for internal users (already done)
2. Deploy frontend bundle to CDN
3. Cache invalidation
4. Enable feature flag for 10% of users
5. Monitor error rates and feedback
6. Gradual rollout: 25% → 50% → 100%
7. Remove feature flag after 1 week stable

## Rollback Plan
- **Trigger:** Error rate > 1% or critical bugs reported
- **Procedure:** Disable feature flag via admin panel
- **RTO:** < 1 minute
- **Decision Point:** 2 hours post-deployment

## Risk Assessment
| Risk | Probability | Impact | Mitigation |
|------|------------|--------|------------|
| CSS conflicts | Very Low | Low | Tested in staging |
| Performance regression | Very Low | Low | Bundle size checked |
| User confusion | Low | Low | Opt-in feature |

## Testing Completed
- [x] Unit tests passing
- [x] Integration tests passing
- [x] Staging environment validation
- [x] Accessibility audit (WCAG 2.1 AA)
- [x] Cross-browser testing

## Approvals Required
- [x] Technical Lead (pre-approved for feature flags)
- [ ] Product Owner
